flawed_nl_solution:
Through March, Dr. Banks gave out 53 + 67 + 46 = <<53+67+46=166>>166 toothbrushes.
Before giving away toothbrushes in April, he had 330 -166 = <<330-166=146>>146 toothbrushes remaining.
Between April and May, he gave out the remaining 146 / 2 = <<146/2=73>>73 toothbrushes each month.
The difference would be 73- 46 = <<73-46=27>>27 more toothbrushes in the busiest month.
#### 27

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 164, not 146. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
